meta_description: The Richard H. Driehaus Museum explores the art, architecture, and design of the late 19th-century with a focus on the Gilded Age. The Museum is located just steps from the Magnificent Mile within the meticulously restored Nickerson Mansion, renowned as Gilded Age Chicago’s “Marble Palace.”
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

Read below for more information on planning your next visit to the Driehaus Museum. Last admission to the Museum is one hour before closing, at 6 pm on Wednesdays and at 4 pm the rest of the week.

Credit card only transactions are allowed at this time.

**Please note: The interior of the Murphy Auditorium will be closed until early March for care and maintenance work. The entrance to the Museum remains at 50 E Erie, up the steps at the Murphy.**

****

****

### Location

The address and entrance to the Museum is 50 E Erie, up the grand stairs of the Murphy Memorial building. We are two blocks west of Michigan Avenue between Rush and Wabash.

[View Map](https://driehausmuseum.org/images/uploads/visit/_xlarge/visit-map-xl.jpg)

### Hours

The Museum is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays.

Wednesday:  | 11:00AM-7:00PM (4:00-7:00 pm is free)  
---|---  
Thursday:  | 11:00AM-5:00PM  
Friday:  | 11:00AM–5:00PM  
Saturday:  | 11:00AM–5:00PM  
Sunday:  | 11:00AM–5:00PM  

The last entry to the Museum is one hour before closing.

**Free Wednesday evenings: From 4:00-7:00 pm on Wednesday evenings, admission to the Museum is free. Last entry to the galleries is 6:00 pm.**

[Upcoming Museum Closures](javascript:;)

## Museum Holiday Closures for 2026

_Museum Closures for 2026:_

The Museum is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays.

Thursday, January 1

Sunday, April 5 (Easter)

Friday, June 19 (Juneteenth)

Closing at 3 pm on Friday, July 3

Saturday, July 4

Closing at 3pm on...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

Visitors who would like an accessibility accommodation should contact the Museum’s Guest Services team at (312) 482-8933 or by emailing info@driehausmuseum.org.

The Museum has an elevator for use by visitors. The wheelchair accessible entrance is located at 50 East Erie Street, next door to the Museum’s main entrance. The Museum has manually-operated wheelchairs available, free of charge.

Large print labels are available upon request from a Museum representative during your visit. The Driehaus Museum app, available via [Bloomberg Connects](https://www.bloombergconnects.org/), offers transcripts of audio tours and copies of select interpretive panels in the galleries.

Service animals are welcome in the Museum. Pets, emotional support animals, and animals in training to be service animals are not permitted.

If your require any additional accommodations, please contact our Guest Services team for more information.

### Visit

  * [Plan Your Visit](https://driehausmuseum.org/visit/plan-your-visit)
  * [Accessibility ](https://driehausmuseum.org/visit/accessibility )
  * [FAQ](https://driehausmuseum.org/visit/faq)
  * [Download Our App](https://driehausmuseum.org/visit/download-our-app)
